claim: We display these regions of significance in Figure 1.
title: FIGURE 1.
caption: Regression of Affect Ratings on Resilience for Nostalgia and Control Conditions. Vertical dashed lines indicate Johnson–Neyman region of significance borders. Scatter shows distribution of participant scores in nostalgia (red) and control (blue) conditions.

claim: The J–N regions of significance displayed in Figure 1 show that nostalgia increased activated PA at resilience values higher than 5.58 (+0.57 SD) and decreased it at resilience values lower than 2.50 (−2.22 SD).
title: FIGURE 1.
caption: Regression of Affect Ratings on Resilience for Nostalgia and Control Conditions. Vertical dashed lines indicate Johnson–Neyman region of significance borders. Scatter shows distribution of participant scores in nostalgia (red) and control (blue) conditions.

claim: The J‐N procedure identified a single region of significance (Figure 2).
title: FIGURE 2.
caption: Regression of psychological benefit ratings on resilience for nostalgia and control conditions. Vertical dashed lines indicate the Johnson–Neyman region of significance borders. Scatter shows distribution of participant scores in nostalgia (red) and control (blue) conditions.

claim: We display these interactions in Figure 2 and followed up with tests of simple nostalgia (vs. control) effects, supplemented by the J‐N procedure.
title: FIGURE 2.
caption: Regression of psychological benefit ratings on resilience for nostalgia and control conditions. Vertical dashed lines indicate the Johnson–Neyman region of significance borders. Scatter shows distribution of participant scores in nostalgia (red) and control (blue) conditions.
